bibl.title: Hazzard v. Aguirre and Price. Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Tacoma, within and for the County of Pierce.

THE TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON ON THE RELATION OF GEORGE HAZZARD, Plaintiff, vs.
JAMES H. PRICE and M. G. AGUIRRE, Defendants

And now on this 9th day of October A.D. 1889, comes the said petitioner George Hazzard in his own proper person as well as by his counsel, and doth except to the return herein filed by James H. Price and M.G. Aguirre, defendants, and says that the said return is insufficient in law and that the said defendants ought not, for or on account of any matter or thing in the said return alleged and set forth restrain the said petitioner of his liberty.
WHEREFORE the petitioner prays, as he has by his petition herein before prayed, that he may be discharged of the said allegal restraint and detention and that he may go hence without delay day etc.
Hentrick S. Griggs P.C. Sallion Frank T Rein John May Palmer Attornes for Petition
